definition.name: Sync branches
definition.description: Automatically merge a repository branch into other branches to keep them in sync.
definition.author: Thibault Derousseaux <tibdex@gmail.com>

inputs.name: body_template
inputs.description:
Lodash template for the syncing PR's body.
The data properties are:
  - base: syncing PR's base branch
  - head: branch to merge into `base`.

inputs.name: branches_pattern
inputs.description:
Branches matching this `minimatch` pattern will be synced with the branch from which this action is run.
If empty, all the protected branches will be synced.

inputs.name: head_template
inputs.description:
Lodash template for the syncing PR's head branch.
The data properties are:
  - base: syncing PR's base branch
  - head: branch to merge into `base`.

inputs.name: labels_template
inputs.description:
Lodash template compiling to a JSON array of labels to add to the syncing PR.
The data properties are:
  - base: syncing PR's base branch
  - head: branch to merge into `base`.

inputs.name: title_template
inputs.description:
Lodash template for the syncing PR's title.
The data properties are:
  - base: syncing PR's base branch
  - head: branch to merge into `base`.

outputs.name: created_pull_requests
outputs.description: A JSON stringified object mapping the base branch of the created pull requests to their number.

evidence.reasoning: The action is designed to keep branches in sync, which relates to maintaining code quality and ensuring that dependencies between branches are managed effectively. It also involves communication through pull requests.
